intro: Salvia japonica var. parvifoliola, commonly known as Japanese sage or small-leaf sage, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It features compact, bushy growth with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces spikes of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is well-suited for rock gardens and borders due to its drought tolerance and attractive foliage. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for both ornamental and medicinal uses.
